_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ase prevention and emergency response policies.  These are described in the operating, maintenance and safety procedures for working with the aqueous ammonia solution and tanks.  The documents provided from the equipment vendors contain many of these procedures in Johnson March Systems, Inc.'s Operations and Maintenance Manual ,  Peerless' Control Narrative and TriTech Energy Services' SCR System Operation documents.

As part of the emergency response program, Chugach has contracted NRC Alaska Inc. to respond to aqueous ammonia spills.  Chugach personnel will respond to smaller spills.  Chugach has also developed written emergency response plans as outlined in this document to ensure the protection of public health and the environment.  The emergency response plan details procedures for informing the public and local emergency response agencies about accidents.  Those responding to spills are required to have proper training and knowledge of how to use emergency response equipment.

Chugach will retain records supporting this RMP for a minimum of five years.
